data.title: Good spot for couples in downtown Round Rock
data.text:
The good:  good ambience and decor.  Excellent light and noise level.  Menu isn't all that diverse, but the food was tasty.  Wine selection was surprisingly good, and mixed drinks were well prepared.

The bad:  service, when busy, is a little slow, but it's friendly and didn't make any mistakes. 

Overall:  we'll definitely be back.

data.title: What a find !
data.text:
We happened upon this place by chance and it was excellent.

Food quality is a 10 and pricing is below expectations given the quality and taste of the food. Service is great and the music actually fit the mood we were in. We went back twice more.. Once for breakfast, lunch, and dinner each and the menu didn't disappoint.

data.title: easy parking, okay food, good service but not for beer lovers
data.text: Came here on a Sunday night for light food and drinks with a friend. Parking was easy. Good vibe but food was really just okay - do not expect too much based on the price they're charging you with the food. If you love beers, they don't have a good selection, this is not a place for beers. The service was very good though.

data.title: Excellent Ajo sauce! Delicious food!
data.text:
So good....delicious! The black garlic Ajo sauce with bread is amazing... I need the recipe! I could eat that sauce with everything!! I had the snapper with kale and it was fresh and perfectly seasoned with a wonderful lobster sauce. My husband loved the fried (boneless) chicken thighs. The bread pudding, of course , was unbelievable!! 
So- why 4 stars? I'll be back for sure, but hope at that time that a couple things have changed. 1- better ventilation... sat at the bar near the kitchen, and felt the smoke was pretty heavy. Difficult to full enjoy dinner that way
2- We arrived early -around 6pm and didn't think we needed reservations. We were told we did need them, but could sit at the bar. I asked if we could wait, and was told that wasn't an option. So we did. But noticed 4 tables unoccupied the entire time we were there! Kind of disappointing. It was our anniversary and would have preferred a table (especially since 4 of them were unoccupied!) I'd suggest to the owners to have some reserved tables, and some for walk-ins. To everyone else: Call to reserve!

data.title: Excellent dinner!
data.text: I ordered the Stuffed Chicken and my husband the half chicken. Both tasted good and the service was outstanding. I highly recommend the mojitos. We want to go again.

data.title: Pork Belly and Fried Green Tomatoes, Nuff Said
data.text:
Had lunch here and ordered the Pork Belly Sandwich. Man o man, what an excellent choice. It had pork belly, fried green tomato and a fried egg, with a spicy mayo. It comes with a side of the best coleslaw I have ever had. The coleslaw has blue cheese and pecans.
the restaurant itself is very eclectic. Layout is nice, the bar has a good compliment of tequila, which I will have to try at night. 
If you are in Round Rock, you have to get to Ajo. It will be a great culinary experience.

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: Great food, awesome atmosphere!  The food was amazing, locally owned,  and the chef/owner came out to greet us. In a word, perfect!

data.title: Get here - FAST !!!
data.text:
I don't normally like to tell the world about a new favorite restaurant for fear that it will be booked solid forever, but in this case I am willing to share my experience with the TripAdvisor crowd.  
My wife and I dined here last weekend with another couple who have dined here before.
They said it had awesome food, great service, farm fresh ingredients, family owned, great ambiance, good bar specials, great value, etc. ..... but being the skeptic I am I was prepared for something to be amiss.
Not here.
They had our reservation, greeted properly, seated immediately, server was there in a flash.  Great ambiance - it is a refurbished stone building, very high ceilings, great woodwork, long bar for food and drink and and see-into kitchen.
Surprisingly, with its high ceiling, stone walls and almost full house it had great acoustics,
The menu was relatively short but after we were served I knew why - they don't try to "do everything mediocre" but they do all their dishes perfectly.
And their presentations are top notch.
The four of us split the warm Bread with Black Garlic Ajo Sauce as we sipped our drinks.   This is not your typical olive oil and garlic sauce - it is special.
The Beet Salad and Wedge Salads were split two ways - the server had it split in the kitchen for us - nice touch - and both came out beautiful.  The beet salad with red and yellow beets looked like a piece of art.  The wedge salad had a wonderful blue cheese/ranch dressing that was fabulous.  The table shared the Duck Fat Fried Potatoes - white and purple fingerlings - topped with a poached egg and a tarragon onion sauce - it was sort of like a potato Benedict.  
Two ordered the Tomahawk bone in pork chop, one had the Lobster Mac + Cheese and I had the Bourbon Candied Pork Belly. Of course I sampled everyone's entrees.  Pork was delicious with their mashed potatoes and gravy, Lobster mac and cheese was great but the Pork Belly was my favorite - wow - tons of flavor and plenty of meat. 
Our only regret is we did not have room for desserts.  
If we don't have room next time we will order them to go.
Prices are VERY reasonable, look at their menu on their web site.
Same dishes in a snooty upscale Austin restaurant would be at least 50% higher.
Get there now !

data.title: Good Service, Delicious Food
data.text:
My husband and I wandered in here on a Wednesday night for date night. We were very pleasantly surprised by such delicious and creative food in a town mostly filled with chain restaurants. I predict more places like this in Round Rock's future.

We skipped drinks tonight, and would have liked some happy hour options, but didn't have to wait for a table. 

The duck fat fried potatoes with poached egg and pork skin was delicious. We used the potatoes to scrape out every last bit of the tangy but creamy sauce. My entree was the Bourbon soaked pork belly which looked huge when it came out but was perfectly crisp on the top and fork tender in the meat layers. The sauce was sweet and played well off the beans and greens. My husband's shrimp and grits with chorizo was Southern perfection. With perfectly cooked, large prawns and grits more resembling a creamy risotto, I would eat this weekly. 

Our server was very prompt and filled my husband's water at least six times.

We will be back!

data.title: Chicken Fried Steak - Great
data.text: I was really surprised to find Chicken Fried Steak on this menu!!  But, Oh so glad I ordered it!  It was so tender, and the amount was just right for a lunch.  What a find in downtown Round Rock!  Nice place to go with friends.  The service was great!

data.title: Very Nice
data.text: The food was so delicious.  We started with the bread and black garlic sauce, yummy!  I had the kale and brussel sprout salad with chicken, it was so good.  I can't wait to go back.

data.title: My New Favorite Restaurant
data.text:
I just love this place.   The food is excellent.    We started with the ravioli appetizer.  It's very good.   I had the Snapper with a lobster sauce and flash fried kale for dinner.   It was the best dish that I've had in years.   You should seriously consider ordering it.   My partner ordered the candied bourbon pork belly.   It was decadently yummy.   For dessert I had a white and dark chocolate cake that was so good that I refused to share.

The wait staff is perfect.   They are attentive without being annoying.   They offered tasty suggestions that were not the highest priced item on the menu.   Albert the owner/chef came by and said hello.   The whole staff was warm and welcoming.

I love the design of the restaurant.  I was surprised that a restaurant this good and cool was in Round Rock.  I would have expected it in downtown Austin.    

Ajo was a fantastic dining experience.   We are coming back soon.

data.title: Amazingly good food and value in Round Rock
data.text:
just opened in December, but my wife and I must have been there a dozen times both for lunch as well as dinner.

The Chef is very creative, so even though you may order a traditional plate, what is deliver is a piece of art both presentation as well as flavor.  

Eclectic menu, kid friendly, full bar, and great service.  We are lucky to have this place in round Rock!

data.title: "Relaxed Atmosphere with great Food & Service"!
data.text:
When we arrived at the restaurant without a reservation, we were greeted warmly and seated immediately.
The room is an unexpected pleasure, in a modern chic design. Marcelo started our evening with the wine list. My husband chose a bottle of Borgo which added great pleasure to our meal. We started with the, very generous portion of "Beef in the Raw".  It was accompanied with the traditional capers, cheese, and anchovies. Perfection! The red snapper was delicaely prepared with a lobster sauce. The seasonings were excellent. I highly recommend this dish. My husband had the seared scallops, perfectly cooked. Usually, in the Austin area, the scallops are over or under cooked. Again, these were wonderful! The Choclate roll won us over for  dessert. Can you ever go wrong 

with chocolate? I don't think so, it was everything it promised to be. This is a hidden gem in Round Rock. Take yourself on a treasure hunt and find the goodies while the trail is hot!' " Bon Appetit"!

data.title: Went for Brunch
data.text: We went for brunch and the food was very good. I had the Rabbit Stew and my girlfriend had the Egg Sandwich and we had the brussels sprouts. Everything was wonderful. They did  not have their liquor license yet when we went.

data.title: Farm to Table in downtown Round Rock
data.text: Downtown Round Rock is notable for many bars and casual dining but lacked a really good menu and fine, creative dishes. Ajo's is the answer. My husband's duck (we traded half way through) was fantastic and my quail, surrounded by bits of chorizo, kale cooked down until I thought it was spinach, duck fat fried fingerling potatoes and the quail itself were all delicious! They received their liquor license yesterday at 3 p.m. and courtesy of a posting on Instagram their long, long bar was filled within an hour.  The $4 house wines are quite drinkable. It's not long on ambiance but at least they have candles on the tables. Entrees range in the low to mid $20 range.

data.title: Excellent new find in downtown Round Rock
data.text: Stumbled across this beautifully decorated restaurant the other night.  I'm sad it wasn't busy, because the food and service was fabulous!  For starters, we shared a bowl of the Soup of the Day: Chicken Poblano Pepper.  It was a cream soup and it was wonderful!  On the suggestions of our server, we had the Fried Chicken Thighs with mashed potatoes and zucchini noodles as well as the three cheese Lobster Mac.  They were both so delicious, we had to share!  For dessert we had a yummy chocolate roll with a cream cheese filling, covered with a chocolate Ganache along with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.  I forgot to take a photo of this one since we ate it too fast!  Food was great and the prices were, too, for the quality.  Great, friendly service.

data.title: Gourmet "home cooking", perfect...and peaceful atmosphere
data.text:
Trying to decide where to have lunch, we were intrigued by the rather new Ajo Restaurant in downtown Round Rock. We first went into one of the others on the street, but found it a bit noisy for a quiet lunch. When we stopped into Ajo, I asked to see a menu, concerned that their offerings might be too few to please the two of us. We decided to stay, and found the atmosphere peaceful and quite lovely.

We were seated by the hostess, who we later found out is the chef's sister-in-law, beginning our understanding of this fundamentally family-run pure food place. When the server came I was still not able to make a choice. Although all sounded fabulous, I wanted something light, and preferably seafood. To complicate matters, I preferred scallops over the featured trout. 

No problem! The server found out from the chef that I could have scallops on the even further altered salad, and carefully told me there would be an additional $1 charge for the substitution, bringing it to $15. I thought that was very fair. My husband ordered the 8oz hamburger ($14.00), which came with fries. His Ajo burger was delicious, tender, tasty, and cooked to perfection. The fries were excellent--not greasy, but just the right crispness. 

My salad came, and was perfect! Two sizable scallops topped the dish, which was prepared just as I'd ask. The scallops were amazing! They were juicy and not at all chewy--delicious! We were fully satisfied and prepared to leave when finished, when the hostess tempted us with a description of their incredible bread pudding. 

It is served in a hot skillet on a platter, made with black cherries, white chocolate, caramel, and topped with a large scoop of ice cream. It took about 10 minutes to prepare, and was worth ever bit of the $7 price! I am not a bread pudding person--never found one I liked.  Until now! This was huge for the two of us to share, and was crumbly on top, hot, perfectly cooled by the delicious ice cream, and we found ourselves scraping every last drop out of the skillet. Highly recommend it!

The atmosphere was elegant and peaceful, with tables not crowded together. The service was perfect, and the food a delightful experience! We can't wait to return!

data.title: Food is amazing, restaurant is quiet and nice for a date
data.text:
My husband and I went to Ajo with his parents on a Saturday night to celebrate our birthdays. We had the Brussels sprouts appetizer, which was delicious but maybe a tad overpriced for the size of the dish. My husband had the pork belly, I had the scallops, and my in-laws had the trout. The scallop dish was AMAZING. I ate every little bit of it. The corn purée is heaven. My husband liked the pork belly, but what he really loved was the extra side of mashed potatoes with green chile gravy. My in-laws both enjoyed the trout dish as well. We also had the triple chocolate cheesecake for dessert which was decadent and very tasty. 

We liked our dinner so much that we came back the following Wednesday for my birthday dinner. We tried the bread with black Ajo sauce and the fried chicken with mashed potatoes. Everything we're tried here has been amazing! I can't wait to try the brunch menu. :) keep up the good work, Ajo!
